title: The Best Time to Visit Sydney
text:
The Best Time to Visit Sydney Spring Sign Up for our Free Newsletters Thanks, You're in! Health Tip of the Day Sign up There was an error. Please try again. Please select a newsletter. Please enter a valid email address. Did you mean ? Updated Articles and Resources Royal Botanic Gardens in the spring. © Australian Tourist Commission 1997 
For many, the best time to visit Sydney is in the Australian spring. This covers the period from September 1 to November 30. 
It is a time of regrowth and, yes, spring is definitely in the air. 
About the only school holidays in this period occur from the week before to the week after the Labor Day holiday long weekend in early October. Spring weather 
Expect generally cool conditions becoming warmer in late spring. The average temperature should range from around 13°C (55°F) at night to 22°C (72°F) in the daytime in mid-spring. 
Expect from 69mm to 81mm of rain in a month. Spring is Sydney's dryest season. Spring accommodation 
Outside of the holiday periods, accommodation should be readily available and reasonably priced. Spring activities 
When the weather's fine and sunny, it's always a good time for the Sydney beaches (see pictures ). Go surfing, learn windsurfing. Cruise the harbour, live a ferry tale , visit Manly or Bondi ..
